thread.title: Lukas Podolski Has A Surprising New Club
thread.title_full: Lukas Podolski Has A Surprising New Club

title: Lukas Podolski Has A Surprising New Club
text:
Lukas Podolski Has A Surprising New Club Wed Feb 15 2017 11:37:36  37:36 GMT+0000 (GMT) Jack Kenmare Jack Kenmare in football 
Back in January, Lukas Podolski proved that there's still life in the old dog after scoring five goals against Erzincanspor in an emphatic 6-2 Turkish Cup win. 
We witnessed something special that night, but at the age of 31, the former Arsenal and Bayern Munich forward has decided to call time on his Galatasaray career and join the Japanese J. League, according to beIN SPORTS 
Podolski will play for J League side Vissel Kobe, a team who have failed to finish higher than seventh in the league since 1997. 
But that hasn't stopped the German from making a rather surprising move. Podolski will reportedly join Vissel Kobe, who were founded in 1995, for just ÂŁ2 million in the summer. 
If you take Michael Laudrup out of the equation, Podolski will be one of the club's biggest signings. 
The 31-year-old is renowned for his incredible goalscoring record in international competition, making 129 appearances for Germany since 2004, scoring 48 goals. 
This isn't the first time Podolski has shocked us in recent months. 
The 31-year-old World Cup winner has been in the recording studio with rappers Mo-Torres and the band Cat Ballou to help record 'Liebe deine Stadt' ('Love Your City'). 
No really...
